div.p: This code system http://nphcda.gov.ng/ig/fhir/CodeSystem/ng-contraindication defines the following codes in a Is-A hierarchy:

tr.td: The individual has a weakened immune system due to a medical condition (e.g., cancer, organ transplant, or immunosuppressive therapy), which contraindicates certain live vaccines.
The individual is currently experiencing a severe febrile or respiratory illness (REFI), which may necessitate deferral of immunization until recovery.
The individual has a documented history of a severe allergic (anaphylactic) reaction to a previous dose of a vaccine or any of its components, making re-administration contraindicated.
The individual has symptomatic HIV infection, which may contraindicate live vaccines or require specific vaccine schedules based on immunological status.

description.value: A set of standardized codes used to represent clinical conditions, diagnoses, or circumstances that serve as contraindications to the administration of one or more vaccines.
